data.title: Difference between Search Engine and Subject Directory
data.meta_description: A Computer Science portal for geeks. It contains well written, well thought and well explained computer science and programming articles, quizzes and practice/competitive programming/company interview Questions.
data.text: 1. Basics It is an online tool that is used to locate or search for information on WWW. It is an online database of websites and online information set up by subject and category. 2. Maintained and reviewed It is generally maintained and reviewed by computer robotics. It is created, maintained, and reviewed by human editors or experts. 3. Allows users It allows users to find or locate information on the internet using phrases and keywords. It allows users to find or locate information on the internet using hierarchy. 4. Search and Display It locates and displays relevant information based on formulas and algorithms using an automated software program. Directories are organized by human beings who discover new websites and relevant information by exploring the internet themselves and by reviewing submitted websites. 5. Usage They are used mainly for research, shopping, and entertainment. They are used mainly to search broad topics, current events, organization or business homepages, etc. 6. Size They are bigger than directories as it includes billions of web pages. They tend to be smaller than search engine databases. 7. Application It is considered good to look for specific or complex information and its advanced features allow to refine the search and improve results. It is considered best if one wants to browse broad topics and it can give a good idea about the amount and type of web-based information on the topic. 8. Searching by user User search content or information on database of search engine. User search only websites included and identified by directory. 9. Indexing of website In order to index a Website, search engines automatically collect information about it. Directories demand that a Website submission be listed in the directory. 10. Listing A search engine automatically lists regardless of content quality. Search engines employ specific algorithms to filter and deliver the most relevant and valuable information to users. To assure quality, websites must meet certain requirements before being featured in a directory,
